p: The frequency of thyroid patients is in constant rise in Algeria affecting mainly adult female; according to WHO (2018), 2.103 new thyroid cancer cases were recorded in Algeria during 2018 among which 1.714 were women (81.5%). Clinical and epidemiological studies in Algeria have demonstrated the predominance of the papillary form (60% of cases) against vesicular form (40%). The treatment of differentiated thyroid cancer, most often revealed by a goiter (85%), consists of large thyroid surgery (91%) with lymph node dissection and ablative iratherapy (89%). The survival rate at 5, 15 and 30Â years, depending on whether it is papillary or vesicular carcinoma, is respectively 95%, 94% and 79% versus 82%, 67% and 63% ( Benouis et al., 2017).
